intro: Salsola lachnantha, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that help it survive in dry conditions. It often grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is found in areas such as the Great Basin and the Mojave Desert. Salsola lachnantha is an important component of desert ecosystems, providing food for various wildlife species.
